results.title: Environment Artist
results.description:
Environment Artist with experience in Gaming, Importing, Lighting, and Rendering in Unreal Engine

Non-Fungible Labs is a creative tech company working on the cutting edge of web3 and creative design to help build an engaging, open, and fair metaverse.

Now in our second year of operation, Non-Fungible Labs has already scaled faster than almost any other company in New Zealand history. In December 2021, less than a year after being founded, Non-Fungible Labs “FLUF World” project was named as one of the top 10 NFT projects of 2021 by CoinTelegraph, and in a recent Forbes article was put head to head against Facebook/Meta in the fight for an open and inclusive metaverse.

FLUF World exists on an underlying digital infrastructure, powered by innovative brands in the blockchain, NFT, gaming, media and sustainability spaces. Having just recently announced partnerships with the likes of Snoop Dogg and Wētā Workshop, we are entering a second phase of growth as we continue to cement our position as industry leaders in NFTs and the metaverse.

We are looking for a highly talented and experienced Environment Artist with a background in the games industry and proven experience in importing, lighting, and rendering in Unreal Engine, to join our Creative team. Reporting to the Head of Content, you will produce high-quality organic and hard surface models and texture maps in line with creative briefs and reference materials, including interpreting abstract ideas. As a member of the Creative team, you will be working from concept art, real-world references and scans, to create and lay out digital 3D environments that will form the beautiful world we are building.

Ready to move on from the mundane and work on the bleeding edge of technological development? Want to leave an impact and lasting legacy with an organisation that’s laying the foundations for an open and free metaverse? Then read on and see if this sounds like you.

 

Key responsibilities:

  • Working from concept art, real-world references and scans, to create and lay out digital 3D environments that form the beautiful world we are building
  • Set dressing our environments with assets
  • Producing high-quality organic (e.g. shrubs) and hard surface (e.g. buildings) models and texture maps in line with creative briefs and reference materials, including interpreting abstract ideas.
  • Presenting work in a turntable style environment with acceptable lighting for progress reviews and approval (including scale reference)
  • Ensuring consistency of UV mapping and polygonal subdivisions
  • Working closely with Producers and Art Directors to ensure their geo (and textures maps) are working as correctly and addressing mesh fixes as and when required
  • Optimising the topology of assets in their scene so the environment runs at a manageable frame rate Mapping out scenery elements and props that help drive the story of the game.

Requirements

  • 3+ years experience in 3D modelling, creating environments for games
  • Proven experience in importing, lighting, and rendering using Unreal Engine
  • Experience creating high-quality organic and hard surface models and texture maps

Bonus points for:

  • Experience creating high fidelity scenes that can run in real-time renderers
  • An in-depth knowledge of our ecosystem
  • Being accustomed to remote work with teams

Benefits

  • An exceptionally talented, diverse and experienced team.
  • A fun and rewarding workplace culture.
  • Competitive salary with potential for bonuses, benefits and token allocations.
  • Flexibility and remote work options.
  • Real work-life balance.
  • Plenty of opportunity to grow.
  • Great variety and exciting international projects.
  • A chance to engage with global leaders in gaming, blockchain companies, leading web3 investors and renowned media and entertainment brands.
  • A rare opportunity to be part of our vision for an open and inclusive metaverse.

results.title: Design Manager - Aviation
results.description:
At Anser Advisory, we strive and succeed by creating smart, dynamic and professionally skilled teams to deliver extraordinary projects for our clients. You will work on interesting projects which will expand your expertise and hone your technical skills through the ability to access the most advanced technology on the market. Your successful impact will help us obtain our goal of being the nationwide go-to professional services provider. Anser provides our clients with advisory, compliance, program and project construction management services at the highest level of dedication.
 
Our relationships are on our credibility to deliver on our commitments, with unbeatable service levels to our clients which has resulted in our rapid growth, nationwide.



Duties and Responsibilites

  • Act as extension of planning and/or design staff for the airport.
  • Liaises and coordinates with airport staff, contractors, architects, engineers, inspectors, consultants, and airport staff.
  • Analyze client problems and develop architectural solutions to those problems.
  • Perform design reviews on behalf of clients at design milestones.
  • Assist airports with formulating and implementing their capital program by understanding the challenges and unique operational characteristics of the airport environment.
  • Demonstrable establishment of collaborative relationships with stakeholders involved in planning, design, and construction of airport facilities.
  • Applies a comprehensive knowledge of various disciplines to be used during construction, as well as the methods and techniques to be utilized for installation.
  • Able to interpret and utilize schedule information, performance metrics, and financial data.

  • Actively manages schedules, programs, communications, various administrative tasks and prepares documentation as required.
  • Provide consultations on negotiations with clients during the project development and bidding phases.
  • Ability to self-research and analyze potential design requirements and governmental regulations.
  • Responsible for adhering to and developing client standards.
  • Excellent people management skills and ability to converse and communicate with all levels of staff, including executive-level discussions and presentations to all levels of the organization.

Requirements
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture or related field.
  • 10-15+ years of experience.
  • Experienced in Airport/aviation terminal design and construction required.
  • Experience in Airport related projects.
  • Experienced Architect with experience in the design of airport terminals and facilities.
  • Experienced in all phases of work including design development, specifications, design review, and construction drawings.
  • Experience in Construction Administration, Construction Management and Program/Project Management.
  • Fundamental knowledge of aviation, airport operations and airline management are required.

Preferred Qualifications
  • AIA/RA certification and/or PMP.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment; adaptable.
  • Significant experience with leading project(s) utilizing Construction Manager at Risk delivery method
We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, because it makes our firm stronger. Each of us contributes to our inclusive environment in the way we act, our level of commitment, encouragement to others to share their ideas, and our everyday, outstanding teamwork to support our clients. We also support professional for our staff and celebrate their accomplishments.
 
Simply put, our firm is better...because of the people we work with.

results.title: Product Design Lead
results.description:
VotingWorks is hiring a Product Design Lead to simplify election technology. This role will own software product design for all VotingWorks products: our voting system, risk-limiting auditing software, and more.

About VotingWorks

VotingWorks is the only non-profit in the United States building voting machines, audit software, and other technology to power our public elections. We believe in democracy and well-run free & fair elections. We see a growing crisis of voter confidence in our elections, and we believe transparent, secure, and simple technology can help. That's what we're building. Voting technology developed in concert with election administrators, with all source code and documentation published for the world to see, modern security practices that provide positive evidence of proper operation, and a focus on simplicity in our product so users make fewer errors.

The Role

The Product Design Lead will own software product design for all VotingWorks products and will report to Head of Product.

You'll be responsible for:

  • Designing the user experience for new product features that solve problems we are prioritizing.
  • Working in the best medium for the stage of the product development lifecycle you're in, whether that be documents, sketches, high-fidelity mockups, or prototypes.
  • Conducting user research and usability testing to confirm design hypotheses.
  • Defining the design system for the user interface across the VotingWorks product suite.
  • Helping with other organizational design needs such as graphic design for marketing assets.
  • Developing a deep understanding of user needs and constantly pushing VotingWorks to simplify product design.

We're looking for someone who:

  • Has 5+ years of experience designing software products for a diverse set of users.
  • Rapidly prototypes designs in Figma, code, or other interactive tool of choice.
  • Methodically breaks down a product problem statement into product design hypotheses and tests these hypotheses with users.
  • Builds design systems that enables engineers to move faster and collaborates to understand technical feasibility of designs.
  • Knows how to balance attention to detail and shipping features.
  • Wants to put their skills towards increasing public trust in elections.
  • Nice to have: experience as the first design hire at an early stage startup. You will initially be the only designer at VotingWorks.
Location, Teamwork, Work-Life Balance

VotingWorks is a fully distributed organization. Team members work from wherever they choose in the United States and attend meetings over video or audio conference. Work when you prefer, as long as you can be available 4 hours per weekday during Pacific timezone business hours for team coordination. We use Slack a lot, and we jump on video or audio calls when synchronous discussion is more effective.

We're a small organization where work can sometimes get busy because elections are never rescheduled, and we care deeply about setting limits and ensuring team members have the balance they seek in their lives.

Compensation & Benefits

Compensation for full-time employment ranges from $120,000 to $180,000 depending on experience, cost of living where you live, desired workweek length. This role will have the option to work at 100% time (40 hour workweek, M-F) or 80% time (32 hour workweek, M-Th) as much of our engineering team chooses to work 80% time.

VotingWorks also provides medical, dental, and vision insurance with the base plans being fully covered for employees. VotingWorks also sponsors a 401k plan and will match 100% of contributions up to 3% and 50% of contributions up to 5%. A full list of benefits can be found here.

Diversity, Inclusion, and Equity

VotingWorks is deeply committed to building a diverse team and an inclusive work environment. We aim to build a voting system that earns American's trust, and so we must build a team that represents all Americans. We believe that a team with a diversity of life experiences and points of view is a much better team than one where “culture fit” really means “everyone is the same.” And we know that all of this is a lot easier said than done. We strive in our application process to look for proven skills and real-world experience. We rely less on which diploma you received and from which school you went to. Our interview process is built on rubrics and a scoring process we define ahead of time, so as to reduce the chance that our biases will get in the way. Finally, we welcome feedback, at all times, about anything in our recruiting process that puts you at a disadvantage for reasons unrelated to the work that needs to get done.

results.title: UX/UI Product Designer (Fashion Client)
results.description:
Barrel is a creative and digital marketing agency founded in 2006. We are a remote-first team with members across the world and an office in New York City. We partner with the world’s most loved brands to scale and optimize their direct-to-consumer (DTC) businesses through brand, UX/design, technology/development, and marketing strategy. 
 
Barrel specializes in the Fashion & Apparel, CPG Food & Beverage, Beauty & Skincare and Home Goods verticals. Past and current clients include L’Oreal Paris, Gap, SmartyPants Vitamins, Rowing Blazers, Barry’s, & ScottsMiracle-Gro.
 
Company Background
Barrel is a creative and digital marketing agency that works with exciting wellness brands such as Barry’s, Well+Good, Hu, and Sakara Life. We design meaningful experiences that help our clients create deeper relationships with their customers. Founded in 2006, we are a remote-first team with members of the team located around the world. This role does not require on-site work.
 
The Role
We’re seeking a UX/UI Product Designer to collaborate with our team in leading and executing digital-focused projects for a client in the fashion industry. This role would be on an ongoing, retainer basis. Projects include e-commerce experiences, web/mobile apps, extending visual guidelines to new assets, and research and applying ecommerce best practices to all designs.
 
As a UX/UI product designer at Barrel, you carry the responsibility to not only ideate and execute on creative and intelligent design concepts but to lead by example, motivate other team members, and therefore, reach the highest standards of work. We are looking for someone who is a creative problem solver who combines visual design and product design, knowing how to build appealing and functional experiences.
 
For Barrel, design is the process of thinking, planning, and imagining products that effectively solve problems for our clients. In addition to creating compelling visuals, our design team plays a key part in crafting intuitive user experiences through wireframing, mapping user flows and navigation, and developing micro-interactions.
 
Responsibilities
At Barrel, we value openness, constant communication, and a sense of humor. No matter your level of skill, we look first and foremost for a cultural fit. Our culture revolves around our core behaviors: Continuous Growth & Learning, Focus & Discipline, Team-First Mentality, and Positive Attitude. 
- Ideate and execute on creative concepts
- Create conceptual and practical designs that map back to the client’s business goals, audience, and vertical
- Maintain high standards among the team and ensure only the best work is shared with the client
- Confidently lead client meetings and workshops as requested
- Confidently delegate tasks to and provide support for juniors members of the team
- Challenge clients on their requirements and advise on best practices
- Take and develop briefs from CD/ACD/account team into execution
- Contribute to and drive the process with both internal and client teams
- Provide scoping estimates for new and ongoing client work as requested
- Continually experiments with new tools and technologies, and prototypes with those existing. Encourages the same among the team
- Provide, and often lead, useful contributions to team meetings and conversations
- Provide thoughtful and constructive feedback during presentations and critiques of junior team members’ work
 
Skills Required
- At least 4+ years of agency experience preferred, demonstrated expertise in digital design. Product design experience is a bonus.
- Has a solid knowledge of industry tools and understanding of designing intuitive and responsive user experiences
- Has a strong digital and web vocabulary. Can speak confidently to clients about web platforms, how designs will function and how designs will be implemented.
- Able to work efficiently under pressure and tight deadlines, always aware of budgets and time spent
- Possess strong project management and organizational skills, able to confidently communicate with external teams and clients alike
- Able to articulate thoughts clearly and concisely in all verbal and written communications
- Maintains a meticulous attention to detail in all deliverables
- Has the foresight to see upcoming challenges and proactively plans ahead to ensure all deadlines are met
 
To Apply
To apply, please fill out our online application form below. We will not accept applications that do not come through the online application form.
Barrel is proud to be an equal opportunity employer dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, culture, ethnicity, sex, gender identity and expression, nation of origin, age, veteran’s status, religion, disability, sexual orientation, appearance, opinions, beliefs and more.

results.title: Staff Product Designer
results.description:
This hire will take the reins of all-things-product design, participating in the discovery and development of our most ambitious features, while owning our product design process. They will design across mobile, web and wearables platforms.
 
Why Strength Training?
 
What if I told you there’s a simple, accessible way for anyone to dramatically improve their quality of life that’s hiding in plain sight? Well, there is - strength-training!
 
At Fitbod, we’re not just focused on the advanced gym-goer. Rather, our product can unlock functional movement, strength, flexibility, and freedom from pain for millions of people. Our aim is to create “athletes of life” - to push, pull, carry, and move well before - and crucially after - our best shape.
 
How? Because we have solved the key problems that have prevented strength training from scaling in the past.
 
Like a workout app for the rest of your life
 
The fitness industry promises quick fixes and shortcuts to being in the “best shape of your life”. This overpromising is overdone.
 
In reality, there’s no finish line to fitness. Rather, success is a life-long practice of maintaining the habit, progressing, and simply being better than yesterday. To this end, we’ve built a workout app that builds your next optimal workout and adapts to how much - or little - you exercised in the past week, month, or year.
 
Our fitness recommendation AI today builds completely personalized strength-training plans for hundreds of thousands of paying customers. It employs advanced statistics, machine learning and hundreds of millions of fitness data points to create highly personalized and flexible fitness plans.
 
Originally launched in 2015 on iOS, and 2020 on Android, Fitbod is currently a top-ranked app in Health & Fitness and heralded as an Apple's Editor's Choice recipient.
 
We’re Just Getting Warmed Up!
 
We’ve established a recognizable brand and product-market fit with proven positive impact in hundreds of thousands of people.
However, we’ve only reached under 1% of who can benefit from our current product sophistication. Our most impactful, innovative and ambitious work is yet to be done. This includes innovating in exercise science with new, data-driven health metrics. Also, our platform could serve more diverse groups of people that today don’t have great fitness tools.
 
And, our user’s love and evangelize Fitbod:
 
https://www.notion.so/fitbod/Staff-Product-Designer-at-Fitbod-062d3a021d624afc9a9de2540ce36375#1eb1f1fd42d34fcb89e6502034cadcbd
 
Design-Based Culture
 
Design has played a critical role in Fitbod’s success and remains a key part of our business strategy.
Fitbod has a design co-founder with over 15 years of experience at small and large companies.
 
Company culture is rooted in a core understanding of who we’re designing for. Two of our cultural values reflect this: craftsmanship makes the difference and customer experience comes first.
 
New Design System Preview:
 
https://www.notion.so/fitbod/Staff-Product-Designer-at-Fitbod-062d3a021d624afc9a9de2540ce36375#f7db313d3ffa48f09d8550ea2f2b9031
 
Mature User Research Capacity:
 
User research plays a core part of our product development cycle.
Our product is well instrumented & integrated with our various data analytics tools. This empowers anyone in the organization to answer data questions themselves.
We’re able to ‘slice and dice’ specific cohorts of users for a variety of user research methods: interviews, prototype & traditional surveys, in-app interventions and more.
 
Solidified and Sustainable Growth Strategy:
 
Common startup advice suggests founders operate their businesses to grow as fast as possible, while utilizing shortcuts such as growth hacks, launch and leave MVPs, hastily entering new verticals and burning cash.
Our approach to company building mirrors our fitness philosophy: sustainable growth occurs over an iterated process of being better than yesterday.
 
 
Here is a notion doc, containing additional details on the role, company and team: https://fitbod.notion.site/Staff-Product-Designer-at-Fitbod-062d3a021d624afc9a9de2540ce36375
 
 
 
 



Requirements:
  • 8+ years experience designing for mobile, either on iOS or Android
  • A pro at interaction design with a practiced visual design eye.
  • A passion for leveraging user research to drive design development
  • Experience with scalable design systems that support a variety of user use-cases, feature expressions, and components.
Try our app for free! https://www.fitbod.me/
 
Positions are 100% remote-only.
 
Compensation: Dependent on level (130-190k Base Salary; Level 3-Level 5)
 
We are looking for full-time teammates!  Positions include a full benefits package including: Full Medical, Vision, Dental, Life & Disability Insurance, flexible time-off, Slavic 401(k) with a 4% company match, company-wide days off for wellness & social lunches (via Zoom of course), a stipend for the gym/fitness, and all employees are able to expense up to $2000USD/year for continuing their development while employed with Fitbod! 
 
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

results.title: Senior UX Designer
results.description:
Blueland is revolutionizing conventional cleaning and personal care products to eliminate the need for single-use plastic packaging, while prioritizing the planet and people. We believe that we should be able to have a clean home without sacrificing a clean planet and that sustainable choices should be effective, convenient, and affordable. We also believe that businesses need to be reconstructed to consider all stakeholders, not just profit. We are a science-driven company with a pipeline of proprietary products that started with our cleaning sprays and hand soap (we hold over 40 patents and patents pending worldwide). To date, we’ve already helped divert more than 1 billion single-use plastic bottles from landfills and waterways. We were the 2nd fastest growing direct-to-consumer in 2020, and have built an engaged, passionate community of over 350K Instagram followers. We’re proud to be B Corporation Certified - recognized for meeting the highest standards of verified social and environmental performance, transparency, and accountability. We’re also Climate Neutral Certified along with many other certifications that help hold us accountable on our commitments to optimize our products for environmental and human health. Blueland was featured on the Season 11 premiere of Shark Tank, securing an investment by Kevin O’Leary. Blueland is well-funded by top tier venture capital firms as well as notable investors including Gwyneth Paltrow, Justin Timberlake and founders of Sweetgreen, Thrive Market, Honest Company, Rent the Runway, and Bonobos. We’ve been featured across top tier outlets such as the New York Times, Fast Company, TechCrunch, VOGUE, Wall Street Journal, Inc., and more.
 
The Role
We are seeking an innovative data-driven Senior UX Designer to bring our product vision to life, designing thoughtful user experiences that forward our company mission and growth. You’ll join our Growth Marketing team reporting to our Digital Lead to design creative and seamless shopping experiences partnering closely with teammates across Engineering, Growth Marketing, Data and Creative. 



Responsibilities:
  • Translate conceptual product ideas into intuitive user experiences
  • Lead the UX process creating wireframes, user flows and designs, considering industry and competitive trends, usability findings, site metrics and customer feedback
  • Lead user research and user testing to learn about user behavior and inform opportunities
  • Identify and analyze growth metrics + KPIs to inform user experience decisions across acquisition and retention
  • Collaborate with Digital Lead to define A/B testing plan along with corresponding performance metrics
  • Partner closely with Engineering to define requirements, synthesize ideas and validate designs through user testing
  • Collaborate with Creative to bring our brand to life in a consistent way throughout the site
  • Maintain design systems, UI libraries and style guides



Qualifications:
  • 3+ years designing digital e-commerce product experiences in an agile and iterative development environment
  • A portfolio demonstrating strong UX and creative solutions, with examples of user flows, wireframes and documentation demonstrating your design thinking
  • Proficiency of prototyping tools like Invision and Figma
  • Knowledge of sprint management tools like Wrike and JIRA for partnering with developers
  • An ability to thrive in ambiguity and work independently, quickly and reliably in an agile environment with cross-functional partners to deliver desktop and mobile web experiences
  • Quick to make data-driven decisions that inform the design of the experience
  • A passion for user testing and experience with user testing platforms
  • DTC and subscription design experience is a plus
  • Bachelor’s degree in Design or Human Center Interaction a plus
At Blueland we believe in order to build a better future and planet, we must advocate for diversity, equity and inclusion. We are proud to have assembled a diverse team and strongly encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every qualification.
 
View our California Personnel and Applicant Privacy Notice.

results.title: Product & UX Designer for B2B SaaS product
results.description:
Company Description

We help sales and legal teams to close better deals faster through intelligent contracting decisions.

We have developed an AI-enabled SaaS product that combines sales enablement with legal automation to close better deals faster. 

We are currently looking for you as a head of engineering in Potsdam, Berlin or remotely to become part of our pioneering work. 

Our team is made-up by an experienced team of tech-enthusiasts as well as hacking geniuses, who have already successfully built several companies. Right now is an exciting time to join a team that is applying machine learning and cutting-edge microservices to further its development. 



Job Description

As Product UX Designer (f/m/d) you have strong experience to turn feature requirements into useful and intuitive designs for digital products that provide a great experience to your users.

Your responsibility will be to:

  • Establish design patterns and systems according to our brand identity and guide the discussion about it with the UX and frontend team.

  • Drive a state-of-the-art remote UX process ranging from user research / design thinking to wireframing, hypothesis-testing to developer handoff.

  • Collaborate with both with our customers, head of product and engineers to test, build and deliver a delightful user experience for our B2B customers.

  • Drive designs in the marketing team



Qualifications
  1. You want to have customer impact. 
  2. You excel how to work remotely (proactive, reliable through commitment, driven by empathy, be fun and stay human).

  3. You have a strong track-record of using Figma at scale (components, prototypes, ... animations a plus).

  4. You are a builder with empathy, a creative problem solving mindset and very strong curiosity to learn, especially a willingness to understand the customer’s problems. You work from the customer backwards.

  5. You feel comfortable being part of and leading a team of A-Players and are able to captivate people with your excellent communication skills.

  6. As part of a multicultural team and with an international client base, you should be proficient in English (verbal and written). 

  7. You are highly motivated, proactive with a can-do attitude, ready to work in a fast-paced environment. You have the drive to continuously improve and develop yourself (growth mindset), bring your growth hacking skills as well as marketing processes at hand.



Additional Information

  • Personal & Professional Development: Through strong ownership from the first day you will experience a steep learning curve, grow on a professional level and take the next steps to being an expert or people Lead.

  • Strong impact: We are leading the digital transformation of a whole industry with cutting-edge technology and share a high awareness for operational issues on all levels especially supported by our management.

  • Involvement: You will have the opportunity to influence and shape the sales development processes and operations in a rapidly growing company.

  • Team: We will welcome you in a multicultural team of entrepreneurs, experienced sales people and tech experts who value a caring environment where we embrace determination and uniqueness, and celebrate diversity.

  • Work culture: Experience a company culture where we work on eye-level - decisions are made quickly and knowledge-sharing, as well as mentoring is on our daily agenda.

  • Great conditions: We offer you flexible organization of your work with an opportunity to work remotely with an attractive remuneration package.

  • You join one of Germany's most promising startups, financed by Germany's most renowned investors. 

  • You are an important part of a dynamic team of builders. Together we apply cutting-edge technologies and see their impact unfold.

  • You will be able to apply and hone your abilities as part of working with excellent and motivated people. 

  • We offer flexible working hours, because we are result-driven.

results.title: Senior Designer
results.description:
The role is based in the GMT+8 Timezone. We can engage you in Singapore, China or remotely if applicable.

About Us

DeGate is limit orders, decentralised. 

We are an order book-centric Decentralised Exchange (DEX) trading protocol that is secured by Ethereum, utilising a Decentralised Autonomous Organisation (DAO) structure that has full control over its treasury. As a next-gen DEX, DeGate aims to make decentralised exchange trading mainstream and accessible to all, with key features such as Order Book Trading, Leverage Capabilities, and Super-fast Transaction Times amongst others.

 

 

We Want You

We are looking for individuals who are keen to join our group of talented project contributors. You are someone who: 

  • has an immense interest in blockchain-related technology
  • well on your way to being a Crypto-Native 
  • has an insatiable thirst for growth and learning, 
  • is keen to build and grow together with the industry

 

What you'll be doing
  • Participate in the design of the Desktop / Mobile interface of our products, ensuring that the quality of the project is top-notch.
  • Using good product awareness, design principles and design process to ensure design consistency and implementation for our product's look and feel.
  • Ensure that our product's various mediums incorporating design - website, marketing materials, presentations, app etc. has strong visual expression, congruence and excellence - utilising design skills across the spectrum including hand-drawn art form.
  • Able to provide creative design solutions to achieve goals across various disciplines relating to DeGate (marketing, website design, app design, UIX etc.)
  • Fully understand the needs of products and business parties, and have clear design ideas. Able to efficiently communicate and fully collaborate with product/operation/interaction/development, and quickly solve practical problems.
  • Pay attention to cutting-edge trends, master various visual design rules, output UI interface/visual solutions with high efficiency and high quality, and put forward feasible suggestions from the perspective of visual presentation and user experience.

 

What you'll need
  • Bachelor's degree or above in the following disciplines: Visual Communication, Art Design, Fine Arts, New Media and other related fields.
  • Have experience designing trading exchange interface.
  • Curiously passionate about Blockchain, Cryptography and related technologies.
  • More than 3 years of relevant design experience, a solid understanding of cross-platform design systems. Major plus if from the Blockchain / Crypto industry.
  • Have experience designing trading exchange interfaces.
  • Strong aptitude for various design software to achieve the desired outcome.
  • Experience and aptitude product and interactive design ideas, able to assess the feasibility of the design.
  • Attention to details down to pixel level, with good skills in producing hand-drawn art forms. Experience with animations and C4D would be a major plus.
  • Excellent oral communication skills, to ensure superb coordination of assignment timelines, expectations and outcomes. Proactive attitude with the potential to lead assignments with minimal supervision.
  • Possess personal ownership, continuous learning, proactive attitude, teamwork and a strong drive to succeed.

 

For Chinese JD

results.title: Senior Interaction Designer (UX)
results.description:
Company Description

At Spear, our mission is to help dentists and their teams pursue and achieve “Great Dentistry.” Spear drives dental practice growth by advancing our clients clinical skills, improving their practice management capabilities and enhancing the patient experience by leveraging both our deep dental expertise and our technology forward solutions. We offer holistic solutions that include a full learning management system, a practice consulting service supported by a robust analytics platform and industry experts, and patient engagement tools that complement the normal workflows within a dental practice. In addition, we deliver live, collaborative education led by the brightest clinical and business minds in dentistry through virtual seminars and events, as well as through hands on learning opportunities at our state-of-the-art campus in scenic North Scottsdale. 



Job Description

As the Senior Interaction Designer, you will partner with product owners to design and improve the user experience across the Spear product ecosystem. The Interaction Designer strategically drives customer behaviors, while refining designs and constantly striving for improvement in the customer journey. This role will create visual solutions to boost engagement, supporting key business objectives and the digital framework of Spear. You are a collaborative, prototyping expert with a passion for innovation and the customer experience!  

Job Duties:  

  • Leverage design tools like Figma and Adobe XD to rapidly prototype solutions and incorporate any user feedback into the final design. 
  • Design for various devices and platforms such as mobile, tablet, desktop, app and tv application keeping device limitations and standards in mind.  
  • Refine the prototypes throughout the product lifecycle (strategy, design discovery, testing and product delivery).  
  • Support the development team when designing for specific features or libraries used on a project.  
  • Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, personas, wireframes, user flows and sitemaps.  
  • Create and optimize graphics and images to hand off for the development team.  
  • Provide ongoing support for supporting features and functions requested to Spear digital products.  
  • Present solutions to optimized workflows, eliminate customer pain points and increase engagement.  
  • Leverage design patterns and contribute to our product design system for rapid prototyping and expedited development and global consistency.  
  • Design sustainable component-based UI elements, like menus, tabs and widgets to be added to the design system and used throughout all the Spear products.  
  • Continue to bridge the gap between products creating a consistent look and experience for our customers.  
  • Help develop and embellish our Spear Design System and Figma component library. 
  • Attend or conduct ongoing user research, focus groups, interviews, etc. using user testing tools to test, validate and iterate on product designs and feature enhancements. 
  • Gain an understanding of our consumers behavior and pain points to use as the driving factors during the design process.  
  • Analyze customer data and analytics to provide suggested approaches to help eliminate friction and increase user engagement.  
  • Identify design trends and market conditions that might present opportunities for Spear.  



Qualifications
  • 5+ years of experience as an UI-UX Designer or similar role
  • Previous experience in a SaaS organization strongly preferred
  • Knowledge of Figma and Adobe products including Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat and XD, or other design and prototyping software   
  • Bachelor’s degree in relevant field preferred  

Candidates under consideration will be required to submit a professional UI design portfolio for review.   



Additional Information

What Spear Offers

As the leader in our industry, we rely on the creativity and expertise of our people to deliver the best for our clients. In return, we invest in our employees by offering a diverse suite of benefits. We believe in offering choice and flexibility to keep our employees and their families healthy and happy today forward.

  • Great Work/Life Balance - Unlimited time off program along with paid time off for volunteering. We also have shorter meetings times and Core Hours to help support a healthy work life balance for employees in all time zones!
  • Comprehensive Health & Wellness Benefits - Medical (including your pets!), Dental, & Vision benefits and a 401k with a generous match. We also offer Maternity & Paternity Leave. Additional benefits include Mental Health Day, and the Maven Maternity & Health Joy apps.
  • Company Sponsored Events - Think costume contests, annual Wellness Day, May the 4th be with you, Friday afternoon "Get Giphy With It", team builders, and 5k’s!
  • Career Development Pathways - Career development through continuous coaching, training, and on the job learning along with a quarterly review process.
  • Remote and Hybrid Work Options - You can work remote, onsite, or anywhere in between! We know great talent lives all over! If you don't live in Arizona and are interested in working at Spear, we will consider each state on a case-by-case basis due to the implications of doing business in each state.
  • STRIVE Program - Our peer recognition program that helps us celebrate one another's efforts and accomplishments. We like to recognize and reward the most amazing coworkers around!
  • DE&I - We care about each other and have our Spear Collective groups to support this to ensure everyone feels a strong sense of belonging.
  • Transparent Communication - We believe in a collaborative and trustworthy workplace with bi-weekly Company Wide All Hands Meetings and weekly 1:1's. We also send out weekly Office Vibe surveys to all employees for insights and feedback - we listen so we can make positive changes!

Spear Education deeply values diversity and what it brings to our communities and our organization. 

Everyone is welcomed here, regardless of how you look, your physical abilities, where you come from, when you were born, what you believe in, how you identify, who you love, how you think, and whether or not you have served.

We seek to create a culture where each person feels heard, supported and engaged in a positive, empathetic way. 

We are allies in, and advocates for, our shared humanity.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

results.title: Graphic Designer
results.description:
Beckett Collectibles is a leader in the trading card and collectibles industry providing pricing, grading, ecommerce, and other products and services for the sport, non-sport, and gaming collector. With a focus on integrity, commitment, and accuracy, Beckett will continue to be a leader in the collectibles industry providing dynamic products and services to collectors worldwide. Find out more about Beckett products and services at www.beckett.com.


Throughout the interview process we will ask you to provide samples of engaging marketing materials such as web page content, e-books, blog posts, case studies, videos, infographics, or emails that you created.


The ideal senior designer is a hands-on creative with an excellent sense of typography and photo direction, attention to detail, strong conceptual skills, and an expert understanding of paid marketing channels.

Responsibilities

  • Under the guidance of the head of marketing, develop and execute creative messaging for digital and social content across multiple platforms (especially Instagram and TikTok).
  • Efficiently work within tight deadlines to manage projects and create accurate, concise, and well-polished creative assets (stills and video) that deliver on the goals from the marketing team.
  • Repurpose existing photo and video assets to create channel-specific, innovative assets for marketing across paid social, email and events.
  • Work within processes and the project management tools to streamline approvals and cross-functional alignment.
  • Monitor performance and feedback of paid creative assets to refine and iterate upon the creative strategy for paid ads.
  • Assist with concept and art direction of photoshoots, working closely with photographers and stylists and in house digital content producer.

Requirements

  • A degree or equivalent experience in Graphic Design, digital design, or any related fields.
  • 4-5 years of professional experience executing creative assets from scratch (Instagram, Facebook, TikTok), as well as display, email and video paid ads.
  • Critical thinker, great communicator with can-do attitude: the ideal candidate will brainstorm and develop creative concepts for photo and video shoots, and the post-production phase
  • Effective communication and presentation skills to interact with the internal Beckett team and outside partners
  • Impeccable attention to detail and quality assurance
  • Strong prioritization, time management, and organizational skills
  • Strong understanding of the target audience, industry trends, and platform nuances
  • Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, social media platforms, MS Office, basic understanding of HTML, Microsoft Word, and Excel
  • Understanding of paid metrics; able to interpret the results and take action to increase effectiveness of creative
  • Comfortable with production-related work (editing photos, resizing to fit on social platforms, creating templates to work with, etc.)
  • This role will be 20% concepting / 80% design and execution
